message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The elevated breast buds and pubic and axillary hair suggest early puberty, and the bone age of 10 years confirms this. However, the lack of an increase in LH levels following GnRH agonist stimulation suggests precocious puberty due to peripheral causes, rather than central causes like hypothalamic glioma. Among the options, only granulosa cell tumors of the ovary can cause precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The elevated breast buds and pubic hair suggest precocious puberty, and the normal external genitalia and lack of LH response to GnRH agonist stimulation suggest central precocious puberty. Among the options, only granulosa cell tumor can cause central precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Precocious puberty is present in the patient, but since the luteinizing hormone levels did not increase following GnRH agonist stimulation, the most likely cause is a granulosa cell tumor. Ovarian fibroma and hypothalamic glioma can cause precocious puberty but luteinizing hormone levels will increase following GnRH agonist stimulation. McCune-Albright syndrome is known for cafe-au-lait spots, not precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The elevated breast buds and pubic/axillary hair suggest precocious puberty. The bone age of 10 years also supports early puberty. However, the fact that serum luteinizing hormone levels do not increase following GnRH agonist stimulation eliminates central precocious puberty, such as hypothalamic glioma or McCune-Albright syndrome. Ovarian fibroma is unlikely to cause precocious puberty as it is a benign tumor. Granulosa cell tumors, on the other hand, can produce estrogen and cause precocious puberty in girls.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of elevated breast buds, coarse pubic and axillary hair, and advanced bone age suggests precocious puberty. The fact that serum luteinizing hormone levels do not increase following GnRH agonist stimulation suggests peripheral precocious puberty, which is often caused by a granulosa cell tumor. None of the other options is associated with such a tumor.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting signs of precocious puberty, including elevated breast buds and coarse pubic and axillary hair. The bone age of 10 years also suggests accelerated skeletal maturity. The lack of increase in serum luteinizing hormone following GnRH stimulation suggests the cause is peripheral, rather than central. Among the options given, only Granulosa cell tumor is known to cause peripheral precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presentation of elevated breast buds, coarse pubic and axillary hair, and advanced bone age suggests precocious puberty. Among the options, only Granulosa cell tumor is a known cause of precocious puberty in girls. The normal serum luteinizing hormone levels after GnRH agonist stimulation suggest that the tumor is not releasing hormones.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The elevated breast buds and coarse pubic and axillary hair suggest precocious puberty, and the bone age of 10 years is also consistent with this. However, the lack of increase in luteinizing hormone following GnRH stimulation suggests that the cause may be an autonomous source of estrogen, such as a granulosa cell tumor. The other options listed are not typically associated with precocious puberty.

We refer to PubMed articles on medicine for help. The elevated breast buds and pubic/axillary hair suggest premature puberty. The bone age of 10 years and the absence of an increase in LH following GnRH agonist stimulation suggest central precocious puberty, which can be caused by a granulosa cell tumor in the ovary. Ovarian fibromas can cause estrogen secretion but not central precocious puberty. McCune-Albright syndrome is associated with precocious puberty but typically presents with skin pigmentation abnormalities and skeletal dysplasia. Hypothalamic gliomas can cause central precocious puberty but would be expected to increase LH levels following GnRH stimulation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The elevated breast buds and presence of pubic and axillary hair suggest precocious puberty, and the bone age of 10 years indicates an accelerated rate of skeletal maturation. GnRH agonist stimulation should increase luteinizing hormone levels, but in this case, it did not. This points to a lack of activation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis, which is typical of central precocious puberty. However, the presence of an ovarian tumor such as a Granulosa cell tumor can cause early onset of puberty, independent of hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis activation.
